content: The album "Kind of Blue" released in 1959 is considered a masterpiece by which American jazz trumpeter?

"Kind of Blue" is considered a masterpiece by the American jazz trumpeter Miles Davis. The album was released in 1959 and is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential jazz albums of all time. Miles Davis was an iconic figure in the world of jazz, and his contributions to the genre are immeasurable. "Kind of Blue" features some of the most famous jazz musicians of the time, including John Coltrane, Cannonball Adderley, Bill Evans, Wynton Kelly, Paul Chambers, and Jimmy Cobb. The album's innovative approach to modal jazz has had a profound impact on the development of the genre.
